reviews.text: Excellent Location- junction of Shijo and Karasuma- only 5 mins from the main train station. Rooms were on the small size but adequate- all manner of toileteris you need were supplied. didn't eat in the hotel but theres a startbucks down stairs and shijo street is FULL of restaurants and bars. hotel was clean and reasonably priced. but the location was just excellent- major junction with bus, underground train, main line and taxi all within yards. would stay there again.
reviews.title: excellent location for a nice little hotel
Great Location and Value
reviews.text: The Karasuma Kyoto Hotel is in a great location just steps from the subway exit. It is just a block from a great shopping district. The hotel is clean and the staff was very helpful. The hotel is older but very well maintained and safe. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which I found very convienent since I speak no Japanese and was travelling by myself. It was a great find at $77 a night (Oct 2005) , hotels in Japan are fairly expensive. They had 2 PCs with free internet access in the lobby also. My room was on the small side compared to American hotel rooms, but I expected that. I was very happy with this hotel and would definitely stay there again

reviews.title: Not What You'd Imagine

reviews.title: Convenient and good value
reviews.text: My teenaged daughter and I spent three days in Kyoto, and stayed at the Karasuma Kyoto Hotel. We booked the room through JTB, the Japanese Tourism Bureau, in a special that included round trip from Tokyo on the Shinkansen. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Another good stay at the Karasuma Kyoto
reviews.text: This was my third stay at this hotel, as part of a Sunrise Tour.

reviews.title: Old, Stuffy & Tiny
reviews.text: Our twin-room (3226) on the 12th floor overlooked the busy Karasuma dori. I anticipated (correctly) that the room would be too hot so at check-in asked for the large window to be opened/unlocked. This helped alot. I'd actually venture that the room wasn't heated to quite such a high degree as in previous years, which is a good thing.

Apart from two large, very comfortable single-beds there was a small settee and coffee-table, a bucket-chair, desk/counter, tv, fridge etc. It was quite a spacious room for a tourist-class hotel and perfectly pleasant.
reviews.title: A Nice Place

reviews.text: The location is good too. It is two stops from Kyoto station on the Karasuma subway line. Take exit 4 or 6 from Shijo station and the hotel is right there. It is a short walk to the main downtown area on Shijo dori and maybe a 15 minute walk to Gion. Excellent.
